intro: Acisanthera trivalvis, commonly known as the three-valved acacia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes and is characterized by its pod fruits. The plant is known for its compound leaves and small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Acisanthera trivalvis is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its unique three-valved fruit is a distinguishing feature of the species.
